name: Mercure London Bridge

reviews.text: When public transport is so good in London why would you chose a hotel a good 10 minutes walk from the tube station? London Bridge in name suggests its closer to the river than it is and southwark street is a dull uninspiring address. Service very welcoming and privilege room ok. I can find better choices in the city though for the £160 B&B rate paid.
reviews.title: Name is a bit misleading at least a ten minute walk from London bridge tube and many better located hotels to choose from.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights in a privilege room with a kingsize bed courtesy of our Tesco Clubcard vouchers,the deal included breakfast.As well as a hot and cold buffet there was a freshly cooked option,had eggs benedict on Sat and smoked haddock with a poached egg on Sun.Room was excellent with bathrobe,slippers,upgraded toiletries,minibar.For anyone wanting a Southbank experience the location is superb with the foodie heaven of Borough Market,Tate Modern and the Shard all nearby.For those wanting to travel to Covent Garden the RV1 bus stop is right outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Great southbank location

reviews.text: Everyoone at this hotel will go put of their way to make your stay comfortable.
reviews.title: Puts the WOW into customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is super, the wine is wonderful. The team will get to know you and ensure your needs are met.
reviews.title: Good base in the centre of London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have never seen such consistent customer service.
reviews.title: First time visitor to London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have reviewed this hotel before but it is in the middle of renovations and I stayed in a renovated room this time so thought I would give another review!!
reviews.title: Average and the current renovations not really improving

reviews.text: This trip I ended up in three hotels.
reviews.title: Top Class hotel with 5 star Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First was at the Mercure which was the most expensive hotel and easily the worst.
reviews.title: Building site - don't be put off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I then moved to The Grange, Tower Bridge, which was how a hotel should be - just not the best location for me.
reviews.title: Excellent venue for the South Bank

reviews.text: Then I switched to The Crowne Plaza at Blackfriars as a friend was joining so we have a twin bedded room which was huge and well located but missed some of the touches of The Grange.
reviews.title: Not up to usual Mercure standard - and a couple of minor irritations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like others I stayed here courtesy of Tesco vouchers. I picked it for it's easy proximity to local markets and other attractions, and from this point of view I was not disappointed. It is, in fact, directly behind the Tate Modern. Sadly, even though the hotel was 70% empty, when there were faults with our room (strange black deposits coming from the bath taps, and dirty linen) it was like pulling teeth getting moved. The staff, while polite and hardworking, also struggled to understand basic english. A distinctly average hotel I'm afraid.
reviews.title: Uninspiring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a couple of nights on Tesco vouchers & i chose it for it's easy proximity to both the west end & shoreditch areas. Unfortunately i've lost the photo's i took of our room, which was one of the hotels 'priveledge' rooms on the 7th floor (very special and luxury as i was assured by the guy i booked it with in an indian mercure call centre). It was ok, clean enough, a decent size, it had a shower/bath a double bed, a ridiculously placed massive concrete pillar in the middle, brown formica furnishings, very shortpile thin nylon carpet, tv/kettle a few stains on the ceilling and a big window which ran accross the outside wall facing out onto office buildings which was it's nicest feature (quite pleasant late at night with all the lights switched out)
reviews.title: Ok for vouchers but wouldn't pay half this in actual money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basically however this room was a glorified office ! and if i'd been asked to pay the £495 cash price for one nights stay i'd have just laughed & walked out. I can't honestly imagine many people stay here without being on some deal or other to be honest as there's nothing very special about this hotel & i'm really not too sure how they got it rated as a 4 star.
reviews.title: Weekend visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff however (with the exception of one slightly bulshy & officious breakfast waitress) were extremely helpful, pleasant & couldn't have been nicer. The cooked breakfast was ok if a bit greasy & overdone (the coffee was truly rank) & i didn't try the fruit or cereal side of things however my wife said that some of the fruit in the fruit salad had a peculiar not too pleasant 'tinned pie filling' kind of thing about it.
reviews.title: Room 222 01.02.13-04.02.13

reviews.text: All in all this is a hotel i wouldn't hurry back to - though i had no quarrel with the staff who were mostly lovely. It's ok for it's location (right between london bridge & southwark tube stations - about 5 mins walk to each) Go there if you've got a voucher deal of some sort, but you'd be nuts to even contemplate paying the full whack for what you're actually getting !
reviews.title: Let's Be Honest

reviews.text: The hotel is being renovated, the lobby was now closed and the entrance is through the back of the hotel on Lavington street. Same reliable standards, clean and nice room with plenty of space. Love the convenient location close to Southwark tube station and London bridge station. Very good breakfast, I loved the full English breakfast and very good service. The hotel staff are always very helpful and attentive, especially the reception staff who helped me with my luggage to my room on the first floor. Choose a room towards Lavington street instead of a room towards Stouthwark street, more peaceful on that side.
reviews.title: A nice and clean hotel, good service

reviews.text: Booked a standard room here and was very pleasantly surprised at the level of comfort - yes, a small room and tiny bathroom, but the bed was large, lots of soft white towels, decent tv, free wifi and all this for a very good price in a great location. I was there for meetings, but it is also very close to Tate Modern and the Millennium Bridge, Borough Market and good transport links at London Bridge and Waterloo.
reviews.title: Very good value in Central London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Southwark Tube isn't far away but it isn't worth getting on the tube from either of the nearby railway stations, you may as well walk from there or take a bus, which will drop you closer to the hotel.
reviews.title: A weekend in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got a great welcome and will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Well above average

aka: Mercure London City Bankside Hotel London
description: A stylish AA 4 star hotel located in the heart of the London Bankside, 10 minutes walk from the City and close to Waterloo Station, London Bridge, the Tate Modern, the Millenium Bridge, Shakespeare's Globe Theatre, St Pauls Cathedral and the London Eye. Nearest tube stations are London Bridge (Jubilee and Northern Line, 7 min) and Southwark (Jubilee Line, 5 min). Offers 144 en-suite bedrooms, the critically acclaimed Loft Restaurant and Bar, a gym, 24 hour room service, 4 meeting rooms for up to 60 people and WiFi Internet access.
